name: Card Cascade
description:
A different type of Solitaire where you must remove all the cards by selecting PAIRS (hard), or pairs that add up to ELEVEN (easy), in as few moves as possible. You can select adjacent cards (up/down, left/right or diagonally) but only from the bottom three rows.  Where there are cards still to be dealt they will be added to the columns in the same order the matching pairs were selected. Cards can be discarded to the bottom of the remaining deck, but only while there are cards still remaining on the discard pile although this will cost you a move (as will making a wrong selection, but you can cancel a selection by clicking on the card a second time and this will not be counted as a move). The number of unturned cards remaining on the deck is shown, and the discard pile will turn red when you are down to the last two cards - use your next moves wisely! 

Have fun . . . 

Andy
